Heading: Number of victims
Value: Numbers vary from 20-23, exact number unknown

Heading: Cities where killing occurred
Value: Lexington, Unknown, Lowell, Newport, Belshaw, Rensselaer, Kenosha, Lake Forest, Effingham, Zion

Heading: Raised by
Value: Mother and Step-fathers, later by other families

Heading: Problems in school?
Value: Dropped out senior year, trouble maker in school

Heading: Physically abused?
Value: Beaten by many of his step-fathers throughout his childhood

Heading: Psychologically abused?
Value: Step-fathers teased him, internal war dealing with his homosexuality, Mother’s abandonment

Heading: Applied for job as a cop?
Types of jobs worked
Value: In different cities: Taught library science during college, one of the most popular workers at the Equal Employment Opportunities Commission, Elf at holiday party, house painter, liquor store clerk, other odd holiday jobs

Heading: Living with
Value: Lived with Mom and stepfathers, lived with college library science professor Dr. Burke, lived with a friend in Terre Haute, Indiana, lived with his lover and his lover’s wife and children

Heading: Killer age at start of series
Date of first kill in series
Value: March 22, 1982; Jay Reynolds, stabbed to death outside of Lexington, Kentucky

Heading: Date of final kill in series
Value: May 7, 1984; David Block, found murdered near Zion, Illinois with wounds matching previous victims

Heading: Did killer have a partner?
Value: Believed to have an accomplice that remains a free man

Heading: How close did killer live?
Value: Victims were chosen locally, but Eyler drove from one state to another

Heading: Killing occurred in home of victim?
Killing occurred in home of killer?
Victim abducted or killed at contact?
Value: Charged with Aggravated Kidnapping; Some victims were voluntarily lured into abduction; Eyler used his charm to get his victims alone with him and then he forcefully had his way with them

Heading: Left at scene, no attempt to hide
Moved, buried
Value: Yes; victims were put in trash bags and thrown into dumpsters or dumped along the highway or an inconspicuous area

Heading: Date killer arrested
Value: First arrest for the murder of Calise but let go due to illegally obtained evidence: September 31, 1983; Second arrest for the murder of 15-year old Danny Bridges, a street hustler in Chicago, Illinois: August 21, 1984

Heading: Killer executed?
Value: No, died before in prison from AIDS

Heading: References
